bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Caroline Latimer, January 28, [1903?]

div1.p: Kean encourages Kelly to support the pension bill with a letter to the Washington Post.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Caroline Latimer, January 28,[1903?]
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
WASHINGTON.
Jan 28
Dr Caroline Latimer
My dear Doctor
div1.p:
In reply to your
letter of yesterday please
say to Dr Kelly that I
think an editorial in the
Post would decidedly advance
the cause of Dr Reed's
pension- The great trouble
is that Congressmen & the
general public have not
the slightest appreciation
or knowledge of the value
of Dr Reed's work, and
the newspapers can diffuse
the necessary knowledge
better than any other agency.
I have an idea that the
Editor of the Washington
Post thinks he knows a
lot about yellow fever, &
has not yet been converted
to the mosquito theory-
But if Dr Kelly can get
a good editorial into the
Post on the lines of his letter
to the Balto. Sun. - & his letter
in the Post -- so much the
better- Please say to Dr Kelly
that his activity in this matter
in much appreciated by
Dr Reed's family & his friends
in Washington
div1.closer: Your very truly J.R. Kean- in earlierpost editorials
